titleStmt.title: Richard H. Collins to James W. Tate
CWG7930

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
RICHARD H. COLLINS,
Attorney and Counselor at Law,
CINCINNATI, O.
Office, No 68 West Third Street, between Walnut and Vine, opposite "Bank of the Ohio Valley."
☞Special attention given to the Collection of Claims in all the Western States, Kentucky and Tennessee. In sending Claims, don't fail to give the individual names of all FIRMS, whether owning the claims or liable iin any way as payer.
Cincinnati, O., April 11th, 1863.
James W. Tate, Esq.,
Asst. Secy. of State, Frankfort, Ky.,
Dear Sir:

Enclosed please find my Oath of Office as Commissioner of Deeds for Ky., within the State of Ohio; and also Five Dollars ($5.) to pay "the State Tax of that amt. upon Commissions to Commissioners," as specified in your favor of March 7th/ 1863.

Please acknowledge receipt, & oblige
Yours truly,
Richd H. Collins.
Please send me another Copy of the Law abt. Commissioners & the forms of Certificates.
